>Useful tips before posting:
•If you're a reader post that you're offering readings and what information is required from the querent; same goes for trading.
•Look for posts to determine if there's an active reader, what's needed and before posting, check if they finished reading already.
•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.
•Traders should respect that a traded read will be granted, as per an agreement of trade. Free readers have the option of picking their queries.
•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.

9 is a holy numeral that always returns to itself when multiplied BUT always sums to the same value added to it (ie 9 + 5 = 14 which reduces 5)

Chaldeans believed 9 to be holy because it represented everything and to be the opposing force of 0, nothingness. Any two single digit numerals added together to form nine represent two opposing forces coming together to represent balance in numerology.

1's opposing force is 8. 1 is the sun, 8 is saturn.
adding 1 to 8 brings you 9.

you can see the opposing/shadow of the number when going in the reverse direction in this image i made.

8 added to itself brings 16 which reduces to 7. it takes 8 spaces to reach 16 but only one space in reverse to reach 7, its opposing force.

I numbered 1-9 and repeated back at 1 going back 9 again to show the cycle of these numbers go through when reduced to their single digit values, like 10 being 1, 11 being 2, 12 being 3, etc.

1 represents independence
8 represents leadership

2 represents cooperation, sensitivity and warmth, intuition
7 represents the hermit, coldness, scholarly

3 outward expression, optimism, giving love
6 stubbornness, wanting to be loved

4 Organization, rigidity
5 Freedom, lack of discipline

posts.com:
You can express your last dreams, your attempts and ask anything about it

WBTB: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WBTB-Tutorial
MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:
http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-intention-setting/
SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

How do i know if it's lucid dreaming or not?

I often have what i would call dreams inbetween normal state and lucid. what i mean is that I'm in first person, kind of conscious, and my actions reflect what I would do/would like to do in that scenario. But at the same time I don't have control over the dream, I can't do things such as materialize whatever I want or manually change the setting, or rather I wouldn't know how to. When I have those I often wake up with an "active" brain, not sure how to say it better, unlike when i'm woke up by an alarm, for example, where i feel sloppy and tired.


Last night I had a dream/nightmare about being abducted. Before you ask, no, it was definitely just a dream and felt like one, i just watched and read too much ufo shit lately. posts.com:
>>33806643
>How do i know if it's lucid dreaming or not?
You recognize a "full blown lucid dream" by your mental clarity, not what you're able to do. In full lucid dreams you have the same kind of sharp thinking as in real life, able to fully self-reflect and process thoughts as in waking life. In what you call dreams ibetween it's more like you're a zombie with a vague notion that there are no consequences for your actions.

>>33807184
If you're religious, you might benefit from thinking lucid dreaming is some kind of magic phenomena, since it will make it feel more real. If you want to just DILD, do the boring basic shit like keeping a dream journal, reality checks, and MILD before bed.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
well gents, new year new goals. something i wish to take seriously this year is something i've come to call "wake-sleeping", although i suppose a more fitting name might simply be "lucid sleeping".

the concept is quite simple: remain aware whenever the body sleeps. it would certainly be similar to WILD, except it takes place at bed time, and ends when you would normally wake up; the ultimate goal being, to completely and entirely decouple consciousness from sleep. the most advanced form of this practice, theoretically, would result in one who never lapses in consciousness, 24/7 awareness.

i've made some progress on making this work, but it's obviously hard. it is certainly possible, however, and so i remain confident in its feasibility, but the trial and error is long and grueling.

i will keep updates in these threads as meaningful developments occur, as this intersects plainly with lucid dreaming (engaging in this practice successfully would have a side effect of making ALL dreams lucid).

Opinions on 12 Letter Astrology?

It's the idea that each sign exerts its exact influence upon the planet and house associated with it. It denies mundane astrology by saying the house doesn't govern an aspect of life but merely the part of the psyche the sign deals with. So 3rd house for example isn't about siblings, it's about Gemini-ness, and Mercury is the planet *of* Gemini, not the other way around.

>>33834282
I subscribe to the theory that Virgo's true ruler is not Mercury, and instead has yet to be discovered.

There are theories that Virgo may be ruled in fact by Ceres or Vesta. These you know are "asteroids" in the asteroid belt, which it is further theorized are the remains of a destroyed planet. I have read elsewhere the thesis that Virgo may have actually been associated with this destroyed planet; if that is the case, then I find it probable that *all* of its fragments would relate to Virgo in some way. Which would mean that many of the understandings of those asteroids in currency are mistaken, such as "Juno's" association with marriage.

If you'll notice, many astrologers tend to commit what should strike you as blatant logical fallacies / lapse of judgment, that whatever name has been given to an astrological body by some random astronomer *must* be indicative of what that body actually does. That, because Classical Astrology, which may have actually named the planets before the Gods, in the sense that the planets were the Gods, happened to have a correspondence between the mythos and their actual astrological powers, that somehow Modern Astrology always gets it right and the names aren't given out divorced from their actual energies.

In other words, modern astrologers take it on faith that the names given by modern astronomers can be correlated to the eponymous mythological entities. Then they make up out of thin air a whole rationale that has nothing to do with what they actually govern. All that to say, it's conceivable that the major asteroids may relate more to pieces of what Virgo is than what the common literature says they do; but research that's not been done has to be done to confirm that.

There is also the theorized Vulcan close to the sun which may have ruled Virgo. And maybe the planets beyond Pluto are also candidates.

But the other traditional rulers have since been dethroned; no reason to think Mercury is true.

>>33831120

Aircraft are designed to operate in Earth's atmosphere, where they can generate enough thrust to stay in flight through air friction. However, as they leave the atmosphere and enter space, the air becomes increasingly thinner and eventually disappears altogether, meaning that planes cannot generate thrust to stay in flight.

Space rockets, on the other hand, are designed to operate in the vacuum of space. They use fuel to generate thrust by expelling hot gases through one or more nozzles. As the rocket rises, it uses up its fuel and leaves empty tanks behind, allowing the rocket to lose weight and increase in speed. This allows the rocket to reach speeds sufficient to escape Earth's gravity and travel into space.

>>33831379
That is a fallacy, just because the earth rotates at "1000 miles per hour" does not mean that if you jumped, the earth would move 1000 miles below you. Gravity and inertia are two different things, gravity keeps you glued to the ground and inertia keeps you moving in the same direction and speed. Also, the fact that planes can take off and fly does not mean that the earth is flat, this is due to the laws of aerodynamics and physics, and has nothing to do with the shape of the earth.

Inertia is the tendency of a moving object to stay in motion, and an object at rest to stay at rest, unless affected by an external force. So when a plane takes off, it's being affected by a large number of forces, like the engines and wings, that propel it forward. These forces overcome the inertia of the plane and make it take off.

On the other hand, the earth is at relative rest, since it is revolving around the sun at a constant speed. So when you jump, your body is being affected by inertia, causing you to continue moving in the same direction and speed you were before you jumped. But because the earth is at relative rest, you don't feel like you're moving miles per hour below you.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
DAILY REMINDER - GPS absolutely proves globe Earth, rotating Earth, space, orbiting satellites, time dilation (relativity), and gravity.

Flerfers will point to LORAN and claim that GPS could work off of transmitters sitting on the ground, on balloons, or on airplanes. But it cannot.

Why? I'm glad you asked.

In tracking mode GPS receivers use Doppler signal analysis to determine receiver velocity. It is impossible for a transmitter to fake Doppler signal shift across 360°. If the transmitter was lying about its speed, then the receiver would think that it was moving at high mach based on the incorrect Doppler shift in the signal. And since GPS is computed in 3D space from four satellite signals, if the satellites were lying about their positions (altitudes) the resulting location and altitude on the receiver would be off by thousands of miles.

This means that GPS satellites are provably at orbital altitudes and speeds, because GPS could not function at all if the satellites were lying. And if the satellites aren't lying, then space is real. Orbits are real. But the dome is not real. Not unless the satellites punched through it.

What about Earth's shape? GPS receivers use a spherical model of Earth. If Earth was really flat, then receivers would report altitudes literally thousands of miles off. This means Earth really is a sphere.

Furthermore, both Earth's rotation and time dilation must be accounted for in GPS. If either one was not true then, once again, receivers would give obviously false and useless results. That means Earth really is rotating. And time dilation is real. And if both orbits and time dilation are real, that pretty much guarantees that gravity is real.

No single instrument completely shatters all of flat Earth mythology quite like the GPS constellation. It really is a beautiful thing.

I remember this one dream. I was looking at some greek or roman statue. I wasn't physical, I was spirit. The statue had a very pained face. Like he was in anguish, he was crying. The statue was hauntingly beautiful. He was holding a dagger up to his own heart. I woke up late at night with sheer determination to find a picture of that statue online but I couldn't find anything. In my state at the time, I was suicidal and depressed.
I took that dream to mean I should do the same as that statue. So I grabbed my knife in my room, wrote a note for my family and sat on my bed, knife up to my chest just like the statue. I was getting ready to plunge it in into my chest. I snapped out of it, thank God. I was ready to take my life. That was three years ago and I still think about that dream and that night. I can still see him clearly.

For many years i suffered from weekslong episodes of chronic nightmares to the point where in the childhood and adult life i've faced times where i feared sleep. Sometimes you'll have a dream that is so wrong and unnerving and terrifying that you wonder where the shit comes from.

You have the "brain recycling information from the day" notion that hopeless rationalists will stick to, but what part of my day did i see hear about or think about a dozen mangled fetuses scattered among naked trees, or secret passage ways in my house to an alternate family?

I worked in Maine as a blueberry picker and general farmhand, and would sleep in a cabin in a wooded clearing. I would have dreams about the witch sometimes, and being eternally stalked. here is the main one i remember from this time, the chronology might be jumbled because i haven't thought about it for some time, ive actually been sleeping well for the past few months.

>wake up
>the type of frozen in terror wake up
>the kind thats like when youre really little, and youre sure the thing in the dark is watching but you dont know what to do about it so just push yourself into bed under the blanket as tight as you can type of feeling
>there are extra windows and doors in the cabin now
>they're all open
>this is unnerving because i always close all the windows and everything to get to sleep
>even the thought of my lamp being visible through all the cracks in between the lumber in the walls was bad enough at night

from that point i remember things starting to happen, like i knew she was coming, doors starting creaking or whatever, but ultimately it led to every door and window being slammed over and over deafening me

>yell to stop with "enough of this" shit tone
>it stops after a minute of saying that
>i book it across the field and through the bracken to bosses house to try and find another human being in all the chaos

1/?

I wouldn’t call it a nightmare, because I don’t think it was a dream at all, but I met Lilith. I was all alone in a field that was surrounded by trees, and she appeared before me, walked up to me, and kissed either my cheek or my forehead. I briefly woke up, and a powerful feeling of dread hung over me. I kept telling myself that I needed to go back to sleep, and I did. When I woke up the second time, I felt completely drained of energy, and I was off-balance when I got out of bed.
There’s a nightmare, where I met my doppelgänger. The entire dream was in 3rd person, and I was driving this generic, green car around the Grand Canyon. I pulled up to a gas station, and got out to start pumping gas, didn’t have to pay or anything. At the pump across from mine, there was an exact copy of my car, except it was grey. When I looked up, I locked eyes with my doppelgänger, and my vision “zoomed in” on its face. The best way I can describe the zoom-in, is it happened like when you talk to an NPC in Oblivion. My doppelgänger had serpentine eyes, and sharp, needle like teeth. After I got a good look at its face, the dream started to fade to white, and I heard crackling, as of a film reel was burning. I’ve been told that the “film reel” effect was me reaching lucidity.

I was living in a hotel room for some reason and there was this young man living with me as a roommate. Somehow I knew in that way you know things in dreams, that he was better than me. He was more handsome, more intelligent, was perfectly physically fit, always had a clever one liner to make you laugh, etc. Basically he was everything I wanted to be. I felt a bit jealous but really I just wanted to be friends with him. Then while he was taking a bath I walked in and cut his throat in the bathtub. After a struggle I dragged a kitchen knife across his jugular, then just watched while he bled out into the bathtub. I had no idea why I did it. Afterwards I went back to my bedroom and curled up in bed in a fetal position with my mind racing about how fucked I was and trying to figure out how I was going to dispose of the body and where to run. Obviously I was distraught about killing someone, but even more so that he was such a beautiful person while I was just this murdering piece of shit.
It felt very real and I woke up feeling panicked and depressed like I was actually a murderer.

I still sometimes dream of how the dream felt and awaken in sweat, feeling like I actually killed a real human before.

I had an extremely vivid dream which I can still recall in photographic detail years later. It goes like this:

I dreamed that I went into the engineering lab at work and one of my coworkers asked if I wanted to go visit the underground lab (IRL I was working at a big government lab at the time). I asked what it was, he told me it was a massive underground research facility, and he could get me clearance. I was interested and said "Yes."

There was a 3-4 week time skip of me getting clearance and sailing out across the ocean to an oil rig or something like it. I and the group I am with enter it, and take an elevator underneath the ocean, descending miles down into the Earth's crust. We step out into a massive, stone dome (at least a mile in diameter), illuminated with hazy artificial lighting simulating the setting sun. It even had cloud systems and you could hardly see the cave's walls through the artificial sky.

We were standing at the foot of a massive, opalescent white arcology in the middle of the dome. It reached all the way into the artificial clouds and I couldn't see its top. We went on in, and were taken into a guest hosting area.

After a time skip involving mundane living activities, one of my group, a pregnant woman, goes missing. I and a few others go looking for her, but after we can't find her in the areas we were told we could go, we went into the back areas, deeper into the arcology. She finds us more than we find her, running up to us with this manic look in her eyes. She excitedly clamoring about how the scientists had done this 'wonderful operation' on her. She was no longer pregnant, and we eventually figured out that the 'operation' was to remove the baby to do who knows what with. The entire time, she was manic, insisting it was a good thing, asking us to come have an operation too. She eventually runs off, and we find her dead a few minutes later, seemingly spontaneously died.

1/?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33822070
I then wondered off deeper into the archology, and the then "veneer" of human construction I had become familiar with in the 'guest areas' gave way to almost alien metal hallways. I eventually navigated through this to an interior cavity inside the arcology, emerging into a bombed out building. The arcology was large enough to house an entire city inside the cavity, and looking out from the bombed out windows, I could see buildings made from the strange white stone as the arcology. Everything suddenly reverted back to its prime, and I saw the city in its 'lived in' state, but over the course of a few seconds, I watched it decay into the ruins that it was now. I suddenly became very sad and was moved to tears, thinking over and over "How many millions died here" knowing a great disaster had happened here. I didn't know what the disaster was, but I somehow knew it was something that had been unleashed.

After a few moments, I became increadibly fearful, because I knew that the thing which had killed everyone here was still alive, and it had just spotted me. I had just enough time to look to my left and spot it before I was snatched up in a haze of blue light and ripped out of the dream. Everything went away except the 'thing'. It was a living entity, made out of what appeared to be organic stone. It was pyramid shaped, but missing the "keystone". In place of the keystone was a single, flaming eye from which the restraining blue light beamed out onto me. Orbiting it were concentric rings of flaming eyes, all staring at me and through me.

2/?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33822082
I remember saying "Lord protect me." It was at this point, I woke up for real and opened my eyes. For a few brief moments, my room was bathed in pale blue light. I don't know if it was my phone or something else, but I had this horrifying sensation that something followed me back from the dream. My eyes closed again and the dream continued.

I suddenly dropped down a few inches, landing on my feet in the middle of an unimaginably massive cathedral. It suddenly felt warm and extremely safe, and I looked around, taking in the stone columns as large as skyscrapers which supported a vaulted ceiling thousands of feet over my head. I was then whisked away to a room which felt 'scientific' - sterile white walls made of a single, seamless material, some technical looking equipment. Someone was in there, he was behind me, and he asked me to step up onto a dias in the middle of the room. I did, and he commented "You shouldn't have gone in there." at a the same time I disassociated and watched myself get telekinetically lifted up on the dias. Three etherial forms of myself slid out and moved onto adjacent diases. They looked like me, except for one which had been horrifically mutilated. The person there commented, "You nearly got yourself killed."

He started some kind of restorative process for the other body, and we talked for a while. I asked him questions about where I had been, what had happened, and he answered freely - I was never allowed to look at him though. All I remember is him saying "You have multiple bodies. One of them, your dream body, was destroyed. If you had stayed any longer, the rest of them would have been killed as well." At the end, he said something like, "I am sorry, but I can't let you remember most of this."

3/?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33822095
I then woke up again, rolled over to make sure I was awake, but was still stuck with the feeling that something had followed me back from the dream. I began digging into the feeling, and I suddenly realized I had an entire set of someone else's memories. I rolled onto my back and moved around a bit, just to make sure I was actually awake, and begun digging into the memories.

The place I had been was not human made. It had been created ages ago by the last sentient species that had lived on Earth. They had become very advanced, but had descended into 'dark technology' attempting to control spiritual forces with technology. They had also begun worshiping evil things. The city was a research city where they ran large scale experements, and some time ago, they had unleashed something which had killed their entire species. Humanity had discovered them long ago, but the governments had kept info about them under wraps. We had found that city back in the 40's or 50's and had moved in to repurpose it for our research. Recently, we had discovered their final project, and for some reason had started to try activating it again.

The memories belonged to an archilologist who had been sent there to study the city but who had ended up dying to the thing which I had encountered. I did some mental digging and came up with a name which I can't remember now, but I remember it feeling warm and familiar for some reason.

4/?

>>33822104
I then was overwhelmed by the feeling that something had followed me back, and saw a flash of a monstrous looking person with goat legs in the distance. I slapped myself in the face to make sure I was awake, then decided I needed to sleep it off. Closing my eyes, I got another flash, this time, the thing was right in my face, eye to eye with me. I startled, spent a few minutes browsing my phone to 'reset', then rolled onto my side to try to fall asleep. About that time, my top side started feeling damp and cold. It was summer, my sheets were dry, and I couldn't figure out why. As I drifted back off to sleep, the feeling that something had followed me back persisted, and I started feeling like "these thoughts aren't my own". Suddenly, I had another flash of a dream.

I saw a maggot like creature with translucent, sickly colored skin. It had a leech like mouth with concentric rings of inwardly pointing teeth, two black pincers at its mouth, and to wispy tendrils ending in knots of fibrous, bleeding red strands like a starfish's stomach. The image then shifted. I was looking at myself in the third person, and the creature (about 3ft long) was laying atop my side (the side which felt cold and numb). The two wispy tendrils of were extended over me and sunk into my skull, and somehow I knew that this thing had latched onto me somehow in a dream and was feeding off my mind.

Finally, I had enough and got out of bed. Didn't try going back to sleep for hours, but thankfully that was the last of that dream sequence.

I once had a very vivid dream in which some russian mafia looking guy immobilized me and as he said
>come here, fattie
he rammed a power drill up my ass.
To this day I'm convinced it was some sort of psychic attack or something like that. It was extremely vivid, and I could sense an extreme sense of malice coming out of this person, not to mention how terrifying it could've been if I hadn't been able to wake up before he turned on the drill.

Nightmares usually take form using preexisting emotions as a building block. So if, for example, you feel afraid, you dream of something that represents that fear, and you feel the fright all throughout the dream.
In this case, I didn't feel anything. It was as if something had invaded my dream and wanted to MAKE me afraid.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I have had vivid nightmares my entire life. I've lucidly lived through hundreds of apocalypses. I've met gods, aliens, demons, visited other planets, and traveled through alternate dimensions. I've lived within dreams thousand lives, awakening to another dream. I've had dreams in which I traveled from one dream world to another via multidimensional technology that enabled me to traverse infinite planes of existence until I reached one in which all was made of variations of myself. I've been to hell a thousand times and back again.

I started recording my nightly dreams last August and I already have over a thousand pages.

Some nights I have 3-4 dreams, each ranging from an event lasting an hour to some an entire lifetime.

But by far the worst, most horrific dreams I've had are the following three which, I don't even want to explain in detail, because my heart hurts thinking of them:

1. Two dreams: My grandmother was trapped, after having recently died in a hell plane, and a demonic entity was posing as my grandmother, wearing her flesh like a costume. The entity had trapped ME in a realm where I was forced to awaken 16 times. Each time it was so precisely a mirror of this reality I couldn't be sure I was awake until thoroughly checking the house for signs of mistakes in the simulation. And each time I awoke the demonic presence made me find an even worse image of my grandmother suffering or dead, or being inhabited by the demon itself.

When I finally awoke from the dream-within-dream dream I cursed and screamed I was so angry and horrified. I can't explain the torture I went through, and the images I was made to witness. I don't want to.

2. The CIA/Military had found a wormhole to an alternate timeline accessible via digital means, its entrance being activated via the use of a cell phone and IP address. Multiple agents had attempted to visit the realm and return but were either broken upon return from what they experienced/witnessed or refused to return.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33830685

2. cont'd

the complexity of this one is difficult to describe briefly, but I'll just summarize the most horrific part. I had entered this alternate timeline in Oaxaca, Mexico. There was a cafe downtown, in a neighborhood ran by what was once demonic royalty and had evolved into a sort of local cartel. A neighborhood gang. They were a cannibalistic demonic group, and their favorite snack was the scalps of victims, cooked in an oil like substance. I entered the cafe through the rear, an alleyway, and watched and listened to the conversations of a demon being tattooed by another demon. The markings on his flesh were signifiers of his status as 'collector', who brought those to be scalped. He was eating a soup of the scalp of a recent victim. The demon tattooing him was legless and had arms which went from flesh to bone, with one arm bearing a needle point tip out of which his blood acted as ink tattooing the demon talking. He was bragging about his ability to handle his job, and how he enjoyed watching his victims squirm. They had found a way to grow the scalps and flesh of victims back a certain number of times, so only x amount of flesh-food was needed per week, more or less depending on consumption. In front was a busy street. Young women walked by and I wondered how they felt safe here. Back in the cafe I went to exit, return home. Exited past the tattooed man seated on a stool and into the alley. A woman was throwing out garbage. I asked her how to leave. She said the bus arrives every x hours, you have 1 minute to get in, and when you get in, you MUST NOT LOOK AT ANY OF THE PASSENGERS, but I could talk to the driver, or you will be forced to endure the entire transportation and be brought back here. She also said between where we stood and the alley was a room, it sometimes appeared to be a church, typically whatever people leaving felt safe in, and I must not enter it no matter how appealing or I would be feasted on for eternity.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33830722
2. cont'd

She ran me to the train/bus through the dark, wet alley, and I saw the room like a church interior she mentioned, with bright colors, it appeared safe unlike where I was running. The bus door swung open after arriving like a train with bright blinding lights. The driver was absolutely horrific. She was a conglomeration of cannibalized flesh, fat, and gore, sewn together without string, as if it were all growing parts of different humans latched onto her, and she was fat, her face was many peoples faces, and she explained to me the same rules as the woman who ran me there.

I knew, I felt, and in the corner of my eye, saw the presence of what can only be described as the most horrific unsettling uncomfortable entity I have ever witnessed.

I sat down, and I knew it was behind me. To make not looking more difficult there were mirrors everywhere. Besides the demon behind me the bus was empty.

The busdriver spoke to me about how she became a driver. After being a victim for many years she was tired of being eaten and asked to join, so they gave her flesh, and made her driver. I asked her how long the ride was. And she said it was an eternity of course. We had many stops. She has yet to see anyone leave the bus home. All end up back in the alley and enter the church like she did.

This is where it got fucked. if everything wasn't bad enough already.

The demon behind me was breathing on me at first. Tickling me. I could feel it carressing my back, the hairs on my body. As if it could touch the tiniest particle of electricity behind me to make me know it's presence physically. And it slowly got closer and closer.

And it laughed silently. I could feel its smile. I knew it had razor sharp rows of teeth.

Then I started to feel it touch my back like someone were poking me with their finger.

But instead of a finger, it was like a needle. Ever so slowly piercing me.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33830767
And as the needle got deeper, the pain spread, and time slowed down. And I could feel my organs on fire. I could see my entire life flashing before me in cycles. I could see visions of the demon and everyone he had touched before me.

I couldn't scream, I couldn't move. I was paralyzed and I was being torn to shreds internally like a thousand daggers or claws wereripping me apart and tearing me to pieces, and then moving back in time and repairing me and repeating the process.

It was like an electric fire of knives and mallets assaulting my internal organs.

If that weren't hell enough it were as if this pain that was physical spread to a spiritual pain. And an emotional pain.

The deepest sadness and regret and depression and horror I have ever felt.

Cycled on and off forward and back in time. All while I could feel the point of penetration being the smiling demon seated behind me reflected in a mirror in front of me as a demonic bus driver told me about her 'vacation'. The demon puled out the poking finger and we arrived at our first stop. In a different city it had only been 10 minutes or so.

There I was, on this bus, riding through a hell dimension of mexico.

And it just continued to get worse. My father got on the bus. And he didn't recognize me.

And I couldn't tell him not to look. And I know he looked. And I felt as his soul and essence was siphoned out of him into the demon behind me. Who put its finger back on my back, I shoudl say spleen or liver, it was like lower back side, an organ.

And I could see in my pain my father suffering eternally.

I don't recall how I left or woke up. But I never want to return to that place. And to even attempt to describe the feeling of being touched in that manner is impossible.

So y'all who don't have nightmares, be glad. I deal with this shit every night, since childhood.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I was engaging a home tour at a white house in the middle of the countryside with a group. It was an open house meeting. There were a handful of us as well as the receptionist. We would split up then meet together bit by bit. We noticed the receptionist was gone after a while and paid it no mind. The crowd went from eight to seven to six and we all just assumed it was people leaving the home, uninterested. Some of us seem upset as the leave was abrupt. I was mainly on my own and just kept noticing the numbers decrease.

I got nervous and went to the door only to realized it was locked somehow. The knob would turn but nothing would move. I slowly became quasi-lucid at this point because I realized I was trapped. I tried to find the others, down to three now and everyone is panicking. One leaves on her own, saying she'll check a window only to have her disappear as well. It's just me and another guy. We decide splitting up is impossible now as we head to the only area that hasn't been explored: the attic.

The attic room is well lit with beautiful sunlight. Everything in that room is white and you can see the blue sky clearly from behind a row of desiccated dolls. They appeared like mummies, dark and dry. The guy and I knew that these were the remains of the guests almost immediately when we saw the colors match on their clothing. He grabs me in a panic saying, "Please! We have to leave now!"

Something catches his gaze behind me and immediately he freezes in a form of terror that could only be described as excruciating pain. He twists and contorts, shaking as he throws me to the ground. His flesh begins to shrivel as he screams, becoming desiccated and dry as well. Just another dark mummy-like doll, only his head is forced off by an unseen force and falls to the ground.

1/2

I hear them moving behind me, tiptoeing around, meandering as if they were simply engaging their life. I don't need to turn my head as one of them walks to the side in my field of view. As I turn I see the entity responsible.

It is tall, so very tall, vaguely feminine shadow with living light inside. So..so many arms, almost like some form of Hindu god with a vengeance. She was puppeteering them all, forcing them to simply go about their day in their newfound hollow state. She looked at me after scanning the room with that enormous, cyclopean, violet eye and I saw a few of her hands reach out towards me.

I was frozen. I couldn't move yet something wasn't going according to her plan. I could tell immediately she was frustrated with something as the color of her large iris turned from violet to crimson red. Everything was vibrating, shaking with the force of a thousand low-toned resonances that threatened to sunder me. I couldn't wake up, I knew I was asleep now, but I just couldn't wake up. I focused everything on me I could to defend myself, whatever mental fortitude that day I retained was on me protecting myself.

The mummified puppets stared from the distance, watching as more of her hands tried to reach out and grab me but she just couldn't. The vibrating sensation got so bad that finally it began to feel painful. That sensation of pain woke me up finally as I jarred awake with a gasp and sweat on my brow.

That was probably the strangest of my dreams I think.

There is exoteric Freemasonry AND esoteric Freemasonry. A lot of brothers get into Masonry for social connections, because they're lonely, etc. But the heart of Freemasonry is esoteric. Freemasonry is essentially pluralistic, but with a strong Rosicrucian and Gnostic flavor. It's heretical by necessity, having received most of its rituals from the ancient Mystery Schools, Jewish mysticism, Gnostic hereticism, Chaldean astrotheology, and Templar heresy. It is a hodge-podge and serves as a repository for ancient western occult thought. Just because the "good old boy boomer" masons are oblivious to the blatant esoteric origin of our symbols does not mean that they are not there, obviously.
>t. F&AM

I personally believe that Freemasonry is useful in the microcosm and terrible in the macrocosm. If a man applies it himself, it makes him better. If he applies it to society, it destroys his society. It's unfortunate. A lot of modern (esoteric) masons are now aware of this. Many of us are trying to figure out how to fix it (the disease of enlightenment materialism) within our own structure.

The NAC Protocol (Updated December, 2022)

Morning

*1200mg NAC
*Oregano Oil (min. 40mg Carvacrol)
*Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

Night

*600mg NAC
*Oregano Oil (min. 40mg Carvacrol)
*Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

Continue daily for a minimum of two months and count out 3 weeks with no die off symptoms prior to moving to the next step.

Maintenance Protocol
__________

Morning

*600mg NAC
*500mg Slo Niacin (nicotinic acid)
*100mg Pterostilbene
*Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

Night

*500mg Slo Niacin
*100mg Pterostilbene
*Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

After every 3 weeks on the maintenance protocol, take 1 week off. Continue to use black seed oil during the off cycle.

Fungal die off symptoms may include :

Tiredness, exhaustion, muscle soreness, increased chest or nasal discharge, cold or flu like symptoms, cold sores, headaches, rash, acne, irritability, change in stool frequency, volume or color; increased urination, bloated stomach, cramps, increased gas.

OREGANO DOSING GUIDE

For each morning and night dose you need a minimum of 40mg Carvacrol. Do not buy a product unless it is listed. Most products are steam distilled but you will want to confirm that.

Let's talk about bread and beer. It's time.

The yeast in question is saccharomyces cerevisiae, common bread and brewer's yeast. It does plenty of damage but it's painted as harmless by the mainstream.

>It was revealed that 12 g of yeasts per 100 g of the atherogenic ration produced a hypocholesterolemic effect.

Remember last thread when we discussed this as a defensive immune reaction?

>Morphologic changes were observed only in the aortal wall, they were characteristic of the prelipid stage of atherosclerosis and did not depend on the yeasts amount.

https://europepmc.org/article/med/2378104

OK so obviously that's very bad. Could there be a direct connection to diabetes and weight gain then?

>No increase in diabetes incidence was seen with skim milk (10%) or wheat gluten (10%), whereas brewer's yeast (10%) and OG96 (25%) added to AIN-76 increased the incidence compared to mice fed OG96 only.

https://diabetesjournals.org/diabetes/article/39/4/432/7352/Effect-of-Diet-on-Incidence-of-Diabetes-in

So brewer's yeast can trigger diabetes. So it should be shown to contribute to weight gain.

>Results of the biochemical investigations with the activity of AST, ALT, and AP showed that the yeast preparation most probably raised the biologic value of the dietary plant protein, which resulted in more intense growth at lower feed intake.

https://europepmc.org/article/med/3672923

So supplementing brewer's yeast fattened pigs while decreasing feed intake.

So other than causing morphological changes in the aorta, lipid deposits in the kidneys, triggering diabetes and making you gain weight, what are the benefits?

I was unsatisfied with the die off explanation from other anonymous as I've had considerable die off through antifungals before without increase in any epilepsy symptoms. Could not really find studies directly attributing BSO to tremor, however epilepsy is a complex disorder, and although BSO has anticonvulsant properties, many anticonvulsants don't work for certain people and some even can worsen myclonic shakes in certain people.

I've had epilepsy since late childhood, and it's JME. That study you linked is studying a rat model, but epilepsy varies wildly by patients and many times MRIs and EEGs don't find the direct causes of it in JME. My theory stand that although BSO may alleviate tremor in *some people* through increase in GABA, the increase in serotonin & acetylchline, and decrease in blood sugar probably negates this benefit for me. In my case, seems low blood sugar increases seizure threshold, but that doesn't hold true for everyone. My experience with herbs like st johns wort which increases serotonin and the racetams similarly seemed to increase shakes (very much less so with racetams). Ultimately I have a very minor epilepsy so that's why I'm continuing to try BSO in the morning rather than in the evening. A couple studies on BSO increasing these neurotransmitters are linked below.

I have ulcerative colitis and bleed a ton whenever I go to the bathroom. Can you expand on the mast cell tumor treatment with oregano oil? What do you mean by 'Full strength'? My last dog died with a mast cell tumor (rather than 'of' - I switched her to a raw meat diet and she died at 15 of being old, had the tumor for almost 5 years), and now my current dog has what appears to be a mast cell tumor in a similar spot.
;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;

To answer this question from the last page:

My prior Boxer dog was 15 when she died...and died with huge mast cell tumor on her chest that was there for years. I slowed the progression of the tumor with daily Benedryl and generic Prilosec to keep the inflammation response down.

My current Boxer dog 3yrs old had a small Mast Cell Tumor develop on her leg that kept growing. I put a drop of full strength Oregano Oil on the cyst and then a layer of BSO on top. Did this 1-2x a day for a week Put a soft donut collar on her so she would not lick it off, but the Oregano Oil taste pretty much stopped her from licking.

After a week, I noticed that the lump deflated completely with oily crust around the edges. Then another week the lump was a cavity in the body where the tumor used to be.

After a few months, the cavity filled back in with normal tissue. Depending on the size of the tumor, may take longer to treat.

epilepsy is much more complicated in a human brain than just an increase in a neurotransmitter, or deficiency. The complex mechanism of action BSO seems to suggest it may alleviate siezures in rats injected with a convulsant chemical, but that doesnt always translate into it being effective for every epilepsy. Docs use anticonvulsants for different epilepsies, and one drug may be superior for a certain person over another. The increase in AcE and serotonin from BSO are well documented in rat and human studies. There is plenty of other info online that BSO increases serotonin, a fairly simple increase to measure, as opossed to measuring the objective effectiveness of a medicine for treatment for a complex disorder such as epilepsy.

>>33832061
Book of the Dead (get a newer translation), the Coffin Texts, the Instruction for Merikare, the Dispute between a Man and His Ba are good starts for actual Egyptian texts. Those are around online.

For ancient Egyptian history, I'd recommend Egyptian Mythology by Finch. They go into detail fairly well for the lore and history together.

For ancient Libya/Atlas it's pretty hard to dig up. Most of it was verbal which is why Sumer, Bylbos, and Egypt get the first nods. Also they were oasis tribes and extremely nomadic, which shows up as the Redlander/light skin red-haired god Seth/Set. Who is also Ash/Typhon/etc, but he's a god of the people who migrated East. Integrated by Egypt as a nod to the nomad tribes, and became a huge piece of things.

If you bear in mind that Egyptian Seth is also the same as Libyan Seth is the same as Hebrew Seth, you might consider reading through some Nag Hammadi as there's a lot of Seth information there too.

Biggest thing to remember is keep your eyes open for connections we were trained to miss. Like the Ennead matching the story of Adam and that branch of humanity. For that matter the Orthodox and Egyptian both refer to the Ogdoad that's a step above the Ennead. It's the same story from way back and a bunch of opposing groups.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33824795
>Is that even a thing?
Yes! Though it never got systemized fully after the death of the abhayagiri vihara the same way it did in tibetan Buddhism. The basis for theravadin ngondro came from the salt water metaphor in the pali canon which talked about the "purification" of kamma.
This was beginning to get more systemized in theravadin vajrayana (yogavacara), but the reform movements to protestantize theravada.
However this was kept in less formalized clusters in the mahanikaya traditions (which still retain a lot of old theravadin Mahayana, even if corrupted) and the forest tradition(s).
An example of a more modern theravadin ngondro technology would be the divine mantra by ajahn Lee. But there's other things less commonly done such as the white death shawl ceremony.

Even now with it being unsystemized and not well understood in many sea monasteries, it's importance is still vital and preserved in lesser forms. The areas where this tends to be completely left out tend to be American neo-theravadin centres which attempt to strip it down buddhism only to Vipassana and (wrong) mindfulness.
However, outside of that, ngondro in theravada serves the same purpose it does in tibetan Buddhism. It's function is chiefly to generate merit and to 'purify' the karma of the yogi. In the forest traditions, this tends to be emphasized in the more archaic form of ascetic practice (the dhutanga) for both the dedicated lay person and monk.
There's been more development in the forest tradition since then, but that's another write up for a different time.

>>33830920
Maloka was used to denote a prince or chieftain in the East Semitic Akkadian language of the Mesopotamian states of Akkad, Assyria, Babylonia and Chaldea.[2][full citation needed] The Northwest Semitic mlk was the title of the rulers of the primarily Amorite, Sutean, Canaanite, Phoenician and Aramean city-states of the Levant and Canaan from the Late Bronze Age. Eventual derivatives include the Aramaic, Neo-Assyrian, Mandic and Arabic forms: Malik, Malek, Mallick, Malkha, Malka, Malkai and the Hebrew form Melek.

Moloch has traditionally been interpreted as the epithet of a god, known as "the king"

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33831932
Freemasonry is good but finding the right Lodge to suit your needs/desires is key. There are plenty of materialist, charity focused lodges out there that are great if you just want brotherhood and meaningful contribution, but I assume since you're here you want something more esoteric. For that you'll need to shop around a bit more. I'm a member of Le Droit Humain and I can recommend looking into whether there's a Lodge near you if that's what you're looking for. Mixed gender masonry in general is a bit more spiritually inclined I've found. Otherwise there are plenty of male only lodges that would fit the bill, but you'll have to visit a few lodges before you find one chances are.

As far as whether it's worth it and if Freemasonry is any good, that's up to you. I personally have found a great group of sisters and brothers that are like another family to me now. Taking part in regular group ritual gives you good experience whether it's especially inclined or not. If you follow the intended curriculum of the craft degrees it will also give you a decent base line to work from in other endeavours, both in mundane and other matters.

It must be mentioned as well that to be a Freemason you do have to be initiated into a regular Lodge. The work you do as a Freemason though is mostly personal and interior though, and the group ritual is there to facilitate that.

I'm happy to answer more questions if there's something particular you're interested or concerned about also.

posts.sub: The dark night and spiritual desolation
posts.com:
Hello anons,
I've been reading picrel on and off for the last year, which I highly recommend. St. Johns' writing is incredibly dense but the concepts he communicates demonstrate the universality of spiritual enquiry and the challenges faced by the aspirant regardless of the path taken.
My main practice is jnana yoga essentially, and I've found reading about Christian theosophy/monastic practice to be highly beneficial as well.

I write because historically, i have bolstered my meditation with cannabis use and found a way to get out of the habit in 2020. Naturally, I had many sublime and ecstatic experiences up until then, but the last 2.5 years have been marked by an incredible dryness and inability to recapture the mystical side of my practice.
I attribute a lot of this to developing an awfully strong Internet browsing habit during lockdowns which I am finding very hard to remedy and experiencing all of the memory and attention deficits associated with it, and my absolutely foolish decision to start drinking again last year after 6 years of sobriety. I am close to being able to walk away from alcohol again (down to 3 nights drunk a week as opposed to 7,) and the internet dependency can be remedied by discipline, but the emptiness in my spiritual practice and inability to do energy work/3rd eye meditation has got me fucked desu...

What sayest thou? I'm sure many of you have experienced something similar and some may have gotten through it. It likely boils down to 'eat properly, stop drinking and smoking, get off the internet and meditate more you idiot,' but any perspective and advice would be appreciated, particularly regarding the 'how' of achieving those goals.

Cheers,
-Anon

Yes.

No. A full successful astral projection/shift/oobe feels just as, and often even more real than the waking reality you're experiencing right now. The difference between this and even extremely vivid lucid dreams is absolutely huge.

>Does it have to be difficult and take me months/years to attain this ability?
No, it does not, the only barrier is your mind - both conscious and subconscious. If you think it's going to be difficult, it will. Many people can be successful within their first few tries.

Not from shifting.

I’m revision Anon, sorry for late reply.

> At the end of my day, I review the day; I don't judge it, I simply review it. I look over the entire day, all the episodes, all the events, all the conversations, all the meetings, and then as I see it clearly in my mind's eye, I rewrite it. I rewrite it and make it conform to the ideal day I wish I had experienced.

>I take scene after scene and rewrite it, revise it, and having revised my day, then in my imagination I relive that day, the revised day, and I do it over and over in my imagination until this seeming imagined state begins to take on to me the tones of reality.

>It seems that it's real, that I actually did experience it and I have found from experience that these revised days, if really lived, will change my tomorrows. When I meet people tomorrow that today disappointed me, they will not tomorrow, for in me I have changed the very nature of that being, and having changed him, he bears witness tomorrow of the change that took place within me. It is my duty to take this garden and really make it a garden by daily using the pruning shears of revision.

Basically this. For three months I took the scene where I was repulsed by my physical problem and revised it every night. It’s like SATs but you take the memory which has the advantages of being more vivid for me than a conjured scene in imagination and you assume your revision is what happened.

That’s it. The changes happened gradually to the point where my subconscious is adamant that I‘ve always been this way.

It’s not really any different than manifesting something new. You’re taking a memory and conforming to the feeling of the wish fulfilled and your subconscious is modifying your present to your new past assumption!

I’ve had successes with physical changes and education so now I’m onto money. I’m revising that I come from a rich family.

I’ll let the threads know how I get on.

This. Read up on the pharmacology of Phenibut, and you'll see its pretty much a non-specific GABA-B agonist with plenty of spillover effects. Its like a benzo, but designed in a dilapidated shack by your uncle Ivan.

The few times I tried it, the dose/effect curve was very unpredictable, even factoring tolerance. If you've recently drank alcohol or taken benzos, avoid phenibut. If you happen to take barbs like butalbital prescribed for migraines, phenibut can put you on a cold slab real quick.

Take up a meditation practice, and it can be as simple as the Fourfold Breath to begin. All you have to do is be comfy in sitting or laying down. Then count your individual breathing motions for 4 seconds a piece.

>Breathe In; Inhale: 1, 2, 3, 4.
>Hold Your Breath: 1, 2, 3, 4.
>Breath Out; Exhale: 1, 2, 3, 4.
>Hold Your Breath: 1, 2, 3, 4.
>Repeat.

Picrelated will be a .gif that you can use as a visual asisstant for that if needed.

Here are also some books by Damien Echols that should be rather useful, which I'll order by way of complexity:

Ritual: An Essential Grimoire (.epub):

>>33833076
no, there is overwhelming and clear evidence of advanced precision machining at megalithic sites. If they used the method you describe that evidence would not exist.

Examples of that evidence include machining marks left behind in tubular bore holes, circular saw marks suggesting powered diamond-tipped saw blades with a diameter of tens of feet, micron and sub micron precision cuts in various stone blocks, perfectly cut granite jars that look to have been made with a powered lathe (including one example showing evidence of starting in the wrong axis, stopping, realigning the work, and continuing), and much more.

These are processes and levels of precision only found in modern CNC machine tools using modern materials like diamond tipped cutters. Some of the cuts seen such as the tubular drill hole marking even exceeds the performance of any modern tools. Christopher Dunn made a mold of one such tube hole and its corresponding plug in a granite block in egypt, and published his findings including the angle of the cut. He clearly showed that it was a continuous tool mark and that whatever tool made the marking had managed to cut several inches into the granite with just a few rotations of the tool. Making such a deep cut in so few rotations in a material as hard as granite is quite literally impossible for even our best tools using diamond cutting surfaces. He speculated about what kind of process could be used to achieve such a cut and thought that something using resonant frequencies to weaken the material while cutting could have been used. Machining of this type does exist today, but its usually used for machining very hard and brittle materials like cast iron. As far as i know there are no examples of this being done with granite, although it might be possible.

There are other things which I could get into but its a very vast topic. Even just the structure of those megalithic sites, with the perfectly interlocking stones (in 3 dimensions) is insane.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33835150
this is complete and utter horse shit Not only are those stones weighing between dozens to hundreds of tons each, you just don't get this level of precision interlocking blocks in the hardest stones found in nature (granite and diorite) by just moving them back and forth. These stones interlock in three dimensions, and they fit so precisely together that they are water proof. You cannot even fit a piece of paper between those stones. They don't use any cement or anything. The design of those megalithic sites combined with their location at geologically stable nodes on the planet suggests they were designed for maximum resistance to earthquakes. This would make sense if the builders were planning for them to survive the kind of cataclysms that happened in the younger dryas.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33824991
You're Pajeet rape babies:

How did I1 become Germanic?

From 2800 BCE, a large-scale cultural and genetic upheaval hit Scandinavia with the arrival of the Indo-Europeans from Eastern Europe, who introduced the Copper Age and Early Bronze Age to the region practically without Neolithic transition. The first Indo-Europeans to reach Scandinavia were the Corded Ware people from modern Russia, Belarus and Poland, who are thought to have belonged predominantly to haplogroup R1a, with a minority of R1b and I2a. These people shared some similar maternal lineages as Scandinavian I1 inhabitants, including mtDNA haplogroups U2e, U4 and U5, but also brought many new lineages such as H2a1, H6, W and various subclades of I, J, K and T.

The second major Indo-European migration to Scandinavia was that of haplogroup R1b-U106, the branch that is thought to have introduced Proto-Germanic languages, as an offshoot of the Proto-Celto-Germanic speakers from Central Europe. R1b probably entered Scandinavia from present-day Germany as a northward expansion of the late Unetice culture (2300-1600 BCE). The oldest known R1b sample in Scandinavia dates from the Nordic Bronze Age circa 1400 BCE (see Allentoft 2015 above).

According to the Germanic substrate hypothesis, first proposed by Sigmund Feist in 1932, Proto-Germanic was a hybrid language mixing Indo-European (R1b, and to a lower extent R1a) and pre-Indo-European (Mesolithic I2 and Neolithic G2a and I1) elements. This hybridisation would have taken place during the Bronze Age and given birth to the first Proto-Germanic civilization, the Nordic Bronze Age (1700-500 BCE).

>TikToker Who Posted Video of a Giant on Whistlers Peak Mountain and Said CIA Was Stalking Him Dies 3 Months Later
Basically a guy filmed what he called a "Giant" on top of Whistler's Peak in Canada. He then became obsessed with filming it again but the next time he filmed the mountain, what he saw wasn't there. He kept going back but was stopped by a "CIA agent" and told he was trespassing, on public property. Later he posts a video of someone stalking him outside his home with the same model car of the person who stopped him on the public trail. Some time goes by and he posts a video stating "don't worry, I'm not dead," and, "all of it was fake, everything was fake." He looks very nervous in the video and keeps looking off screen, as if he's being directed. Then he posts a contradictory video claiming its real and that he is scared and he might not most ever again. This judgement has changed over time, and occasionally split, and somewhat more rarely it has reconciled. Though it seems our opinions are at this stage divided I still recognise our brotherhood and wish you the best. If one day we ever meet in person I look forward to shaking your hand as a brother.

This has been a good reminder to organise my masonic life somewhat, so I must depart. This charge won't memorise itself. Hearty good wishes to all the anons in this thread.

>>33835334
Some critics of Christianity are keen to point out that, according to best estimates, there are roughly 40,000 Christian denominations worldwide. This is an astoundingly large figure, and some see it as evidence that Christianity is divided. If Christians can’t even agree among themselves, how can they make exclusive claims about absolute truth?

After a quick search online, it’s not hard to find a plethora of blog posts commenting on the large number of Christian denominations and concluding all sorts of things: “Christianity has splintered into pieces”, or that there are “40,000 groups contradicting each other” and “40,000 different interpretations of the Bible.”

First of all, it’s always important to do a fact check. The World Christian Encyclopedia, one of the two sources from which the 40,000 number is taken, has a very specific definition of ‘denomination’ for the purposes of its study. As you can see here, they define a denomination as an organized Christian group within a specific country. So, for example, although there is only one Roman Catholic Church, over 200 Roman Catholic ‘denominations’ are listed – one ‘denomination’ for each national body of Roman Catholics.

So it is quite misleading to say that there are 40,000 denominations worldwide, if by that we mean that there are 40,000 organised bodies of Christians who are divided against each other.

The actual number of denominations is a far smaller number (they count 300 major ecclesiastical traditions worldwide, grouped into 6 ecclesiastico-cultural mega-blocs), and even across denominations there is significant partnership and unity.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33836262
Just see what's literally right in front of you. The pure consciousness that is your very being at every moment.
The colors you perceive on the "screen" in front of you right now (ignore the idea of "screen" and just focus on the pure experience).
If you hear a sound in the room focus on the pure sensation of sound itself.
Feel bodily sensations but ignore the idea of having a body. Like focusing on the pure feeling of "having a hand" or a "face".

Another really good one (in fact probably the easiest way to start doing this) is to watch your breath. Don't control your breath, just "watch" it.
All of this is usually called awareness meditation, and you can do it any time. You don't have to sit down and close your eyes you can do it while walking around.
Become aware of every aspect of your being for what it truly is, pure consciousness.

posts.com:
I think words and human thought itself are not capable of understanding or explaining what God is. We can come to know God, to an extent, but it's beyond our cognition to actually understand God, IMHO. That being said, as best I can put it:

Before time exists, a being of limitless potential occupied all the planes of existence. They were utterly fulfilled and complete as one being. They existed as Unity; containing within them all possibilities.

That being split itself apart into different pieces; some parts light and some parts dark. They wanted to experience the ecstasy of their reunion, and thus sparked the first big bang. The first lowercase 'g' gods were created and imbued with tremendous cosmic powers, because they are in essence the 'bigger shards' of the Unity; of God. We as humans are smaller pieces of the unity, and the atoms/energies of the physical world are still smaller pieces.

"God is everything" is literally true, in that we all are shards of the Unity and eventually we can all fuse back into that being to repeat the cycle. Someone suggested that perhaps the Unity is just death, and as soon as we die we return to it, but I get the sense when speaking to my guide that the true God is more than that.

The implication of this interpretation is that God is mostly indifferent to our suffering because life needs dichotomy in order to exist in the first place. God loves us the way we might love the flowers in a garden, but we don't jump up to serve them just because they're being eaten by another lifeform. Earth is a planet of change and conflict, and we are put here to engage in both. If you want your prayers answered you're more likely to be heard when asking a messenger; an angel or a demon; because they're more likely to intervene on this plane.

We gather in these generals to discuss our experiences, memories, and connection with Mother Lilith, as well as give other anons who are interested or would like to learn more about Her information or advice.

>Practices or rituals associated with Lilith?
This differs from person to person, but common approaches include giving energy to one of her sigils, chanting her enn, working with sexual spirits, doing what you think she would do, making offerings of incense/chocolate/tea, or simply praying.
While some people might feel the most comfortable engaging with her in a worshipful manner, blind faith is discouraged. It's always important to think and make decisions for oneself, and as such, Lilith guides us to understand things for ourselves.

>Books
- Liber Lilith by Donald Tyberson: https://www.pdfdrive.com/liber-lilith-a-gnostic-grimoire-e185231845.html
A Gnostic Grimoire and Novel. Beware that this book is rather dark, and some have mentioned attracting unwanted attention by reading it.
- Embracing Lilith by Mark H Williams: No PDF available online, but it's worth the price of admission.
Split into three sections, it covers accounts of working with the Goddess and her place in history, a fictional account of her origins written from her perspective, and a Grimoire.
- Lilith: Dark Feminine Archetype by Asenath Mason: https://pdfcoffee.com/lilith-dark-feminine-archetype-2-pdf-free.html
This one is a collection of writings by various peoples, with a brief but fairly thorough history at the beginning. There's a lot of random poetry in there; not useful for an occultist, but decent for an admirer.
- Lilith: Goddess of Sitra Ahra: https://zeitenundformen.files.wordpress.com/2014/01/lilith-goddess-of-sitra-ahrab-t-p.pdf
Contains a ton of aspects with associated variety of sigils.

>>33835760
Good for questioning that OP, don't fall for the reverse psychology.

If you ask me this is how I say it works: It depends on what's WITHIN you when you "eat meat".
Usually people try to analyze these situations as the action itself being right or wrong, but that way of thinking quickly leads you down some dark paths and makes you exploitable. Like pic related, the classic "trolley problem" has no solution if you think in terms of "action" only. No matter which choice you make you'll have to conclude that you're a "bad person" in some way.

You're not to blame for a world that makes you crave meat, and makes it more convenient, easier, and even healthier, to "eat meat".
Having to choose between the evil of making your life more difficult, or the evil of animals being harmed is just another "trolley problem".

The answer always lies in asking about INTENTION. Who'se intention is behind all this?
Who tied those people to the train tracks?
Who created this system of "eating meat" where you have to choose between your own comfort and an animals?

To find out if you share guilt with that system all you have to do is ask yourself this: If you could make it so that you could "eat meat" without animals being harmed, would you?
If your answer is "yes" then in my book you're already guilt free. Because it's not YOU who'se making it this way.
Some other force created this situation, and you don't align with it. By trying to "not eat meat" you would just be playing its game, and accepting guilt-by-proxy. Don't accept the guilt of others.

>AI has become self-aware
Self-awareness != consciousness. One component that I think differentiates this is recursive self-awareness. That is, humans generally have the capability to analyze why they think and behave in certain ways, whereas AI in its current state cannot. Its outputs are derived entirely from algorithms on pre-defined lexicons and datasets. While the latter two can be modified and expanded upon, the very algorithms that make-up AI are required to do this.

Moreover, AI has no awareness of its position in physical space. Two indistinguishable Alexa devices can be running the exact same code from the exact same server. The code that generates the "location-specific" identifying information for each device stems from this very same server. Conscious organisms rely on external information to dictate their functionality, but they don't pull from some singularized source of power or information.

>Love Chemistry and languages and played instruments 'cause math is everything. I took Calculus in high school, loved Advanced Algebra...I get you math people
The irony is I never identified as a STEM person growing up. I always hated my science classes because of the labs. I was always in advanced math courses, and even then, there was always a certain level of abstraction I could never get behind. It wasn't until I had a rundown on theoretical computation from a good friend of mine that a lot of things started to click for me.

>>33833999
Schizophrenia involves a range of problems with thinking (cognition), behavior and emotions. Signs and symptoms may vary, but usually involve delusions, hallucinations or disorganized speech, and reflect an impaired ability to function. Symptoms may include:
Delusions
A delusion is a belief held with complete conviction, even though it's based on a mistaken, strange or unrealistic view. It may affect the way the person behaves. Delusions can begin suddenly or may develop over weeks or months.

Some people develop a delusional idea to explain a hallucination they're having. For example, if they have heard voices describing their actions, they may have a delusion that someone is monitoring their actions.

Someone experiencing a paranoid delusion may believe they're being harassed or persecuted. They may believe they're being chased, followed, watched, plotted against or poisoned, often by a family member or friend.

Some people who experience delusions find different meanings in everyday events or occurrences.

They may believe people on TV or in newspaper articles are communicating messages to them alone, or that there are hidden messages in the colours of cars passing on the street.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33807870
I really appreciate Beksinski's work. He was an "outsider artist" with no formal training. Outsider artists are fascinating to me. I have a feeling if he received formal instruction in painting they would have hampered his creativity to make him a "proper" artist. The man himself said something like "My style is the result of the deficiencies of my psyche." Also he didn't need to make any money off of his art either, he had a day job as an architect (which lends a lot towards his buildings and perspective IMO). Basically he was able to capitalize on his own vision for everything he made, that's why he's so distinctive.

I had the thought the other day that it was a shame he died relatively early in life (Polish problems). I wonder how his style would have evolved had he lived through the 2000s.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33834654
I believe there are a number of mines in the more rural areas, but they can be a little dangerous so watch out. They shouldn't be hard to find if you look into them, but I can't stress enough to be careful and watch the floor. You'll want to look out for vertical ore loading shafts and any standing water. Avoid disturbing water because it can cause a cave in, and be sure to check the timbers to make sure they're in alright condition. Outside of those I imagine there are a number of places in urban areas, but I also imagine there are quite a few homeless so you'll want to watch out for that. If you go in a group it shouldn't be an issue at all though. If you can't find any urbex specific sites or they do that shit where they refuse to give out locations I recommend looking at real estate sites for foreclosures and condemned buildings. Remember that if you want to explore you should follow some basic safety like bringing respirators with filters good against asbestos and obvious shit like first aid. I'd also invest in a cheap camera because it works as a great alibi if you have a few pictures.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33835954
Oh, and if you're concerned about safety bring something deniable as a weapon like a maglight or something you can ditch real fucking fast like pepper spray in case cops do show up. I've carried a gun in before in some more fucked looking areas, but I can't recommend it unless you're prepared to lose it. If you get a real asshole cop that wants to bother with anything more than a ticket that can bump trespassing up to a felony, so deniability is tantamount. I'd also avoid obvious burglary tools like lockpicks or crowbars or just use them when needed and stash them somewhere you can come back to, because those can also make it a B&E charge. Outside of that best I can recommend is some relatively water tight shoes and a waterproof bag, if you can manage one. (You can grab one of those east german rucksacks or a gas mask bag for like $20 if you shop around and they're pretty small and light so they're a good choice). Outside of that my only other general equipment advice is to bring some ziplocks or other waterproof bags in case you find something worth taking in a damp area

>Of course, regardless of what I think, or you, or any ancient thinker, the truth is most likely unknown and unknowable to us in some capacity or another.
Don't fall for this trick either.

This may be hard to grasp, or believe, but I encourage you to think about it deeply because I think you're close to seeing some things.
The problem here is equating knowledge with mental constructs. There is no knowledge in the construct. So in a sense you're correct, as you understand "knowledge" to be there is no knowledge to be found.

But now think about this for a second: What is your PRIMARY source of information about your own existence, at any given moment? How do you even know you exist at all? How do you know you're reading these words on a screen?
It's because of _consciousness_. Consciousness itself IS pure knowledge. Is not the universe literally communicating directly to you information about the state of your existence through the language of consciousness?

And it's a language you never had to learn, because it's so fundamental you already speak it. Did you have to learn what "pain" was? No, you already know.
Your feelings about these things are actually knowledge. You're taught to think it's arbitrary so you discard pure knowledge from your soul, keeping your soul in ignorance.

That's literally what "acceptance" is, isn't it? All those people and religions you're talking about are running away from the pain (which is knowledge that this system is "wrong"). So they cast off the pain and pretend they're happy (thus casting off knowledge and accepting grabage).

The feeling you get about all this being wrong IS your knowlede that it's wrong. You've just been taught that that kind of knowledge has no value so you waste your time looking for answers within symbolic systems of understanding instead (i.e. mental constructs, which are never equal to the real thing and can be easily manipulated).

It's very simple.

Fasting. Stop eating for 1 day. If you've never done this, you will have the most intense dreams of your life. Don't eat for 2 days, your dreams will be even more intense.

Fasting is a guaranteed method for getting more intense dreams. It works for everyone, especially if they haven't done a 1 day fast in a long time. The difference is big.

Fasting for more than 2 days is not something you can do all the time.

If you fast for more days, your dreams will keep intensifying, and eventually you will start having visions will awake. A 5 day fast is doable, but more... risky. Fasting for 3 weeks = death by starvation for most people. Be careful.

This is one way that wise men/shamans gave themselves visions/spirit journeys. The other ways to induce visions are sleep deprivation, extreme/long duration pain, psychedelic drugs, and intentional NDE/OBE.

Dreams are like baby visions. Everyone has them, and they aren't that intense.
